title: Part A
stimulusHtml: 3 points are earned: 1 point for a description of each step in the process of generating electricity at a hydroelectric dam.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

3 points are earned: 1 point for a description of each step in the process of generating electricity at a hydroelectric dam.

The student response earns one of the following points:

3 points are earned: 1 point for a description of each step in the process of generating electricity at a hydroelectric dam.

The student response earns two of the following points:

3 points are earned: 1 point for a description of each step in the process of generating electricity at a hydroelectric dam.

The student response earns all of the following points:

3 points are earned: 1 point for a description of each step in the process of generating electricity at a hydroelectric dam.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
2 points are earned: 1 point for each correct identification of an economic benefit. Only the first two identifications can earn a point.

•Recreation/tourism

•Job creation

•Provision of water for domestic, industrial, or agricultural use

•Commercial fisheries

•Commercial shipping

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for: a correct description of an ecological benefit of seasonal flooding of the floodplain.)

•Flooding can deposit nutrients/increase soil fertility

•Sediment can create banks

•Sediment can build/replenish soil

•Overflow can deposit seeds

•Flooding can recharge the aquifer

•Overflow can create/maintain habitat for fish and birds (e.g., riparian zones, wetlands)

•Flooding can decrease soil/water salinization

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for: correct explanation of how dam removal benefits fish populations.

•Restoration of wetland/riparian habitats supports fish populations

•Removal of barrier allows fish migration/increases access to habitats/mates

•Removal of dam turbines/spillway decreases fish mortality

•Restoration of pre-dam conditions (e.g. water temperature, habitat, dissolved oxygen, turbidity) benefits native species

1 point is earned for: correct description of a negative environmental consequence of dam removal.

•Loss of lake habitat/species or downstream habitat/species following restoration of pre-dam conditions

•Increased deposition of sediment downstream

•Erosion of stream banks by high flow following rapid dam removal

•Increased turbidity from release of silt/sediment

•Movement of pollutants accumulated behind the dam downstream

•Change of water temperatures downstream

•Spread of invasive species

•Increased turbidity from release of silt/sediment

•Change of water temperatures downstream

•Spread of invasive species

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for: a correct definition of a keystone species.

•Has a large effect on its environment relative to its abundance

•Increases ecosystem stability OR reduces ecosystem stability when absent

1 point is earned for: a description of how beaver dams transform their environment linked to impact on other species.

•Creation of habitats/alteration of existing habitat

•Fewer floods maintains habitat stability

•Removal of water-borne pollutants increases survival of aquatic life

•Entrapment of sediments behind dam creates habitat/reduces turbidity

•Reduction of erosion of stream banks
